intro: Adenocalymma prasinum, commonly known as the green adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
